intro: Cyanea platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are usually broad and flat, giving it its common name. Cyanea platyphylla is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
